scenarioDescription:
The TIC 237913194 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TIC 237913194 is a star with 1.03 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.09 times its radius. It is located 998.24 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TIC 237913194 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TIC 237913194 system


TIC 237913194 b

TIC 237913194 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-12, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TIC 237913194 b is 617.556 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TIC 237913194 b is 12.520 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TIC 237913194 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TIC 237913194, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TIC 237913194 - System With 1 Exoplanet
